p: Another advantage of the 3rd generation X-ray synchrotron beams with high coherence is the ability to focus them to hundred nanometer sizes and below [ 47, 48, 49]. With such small focus sizes only a limited number of particles may be illuminated by a single X-ray spot. This will naturally lead to fluctuations of intensity when the X-ray spot will be moved from one part of the sample to another. In this case a raster scan of the sample with a focused X-ray beam may be performed to obtain structural information on ensemble average orientational order over a large area of the sample.
